com.nuecho.rivr.voicexml.turn.output.interaction
Class SpeechRecognitionConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.nuecho.rivr.voicexml.turn.output.interaction.SpeechRecognitionConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
JsonSerializable
public final class SpeechRecognitionConfiguration
extends Object

A SpeechRecognitionConfiguration represents the speech part of an interaction phase recognition configuration. It is composed of a list of speech GrammarItem and optional properties (complete timeout, incomplete timeout, max speech timeout, max nbest, confidence level, speed versus accuracy and sensitivity).

Method Detail

setCompleteTimeout

public void setCompleteTimeout(TimeValue completeTimeout)
Parameters:
completeTimeout - The required length of silence following user speech before the speech recognizer finalizes a complete result. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/#dml6.3.2

setIncompleteTimeout

public void setIncompleteTimeout(TimeValue incompleteTimeout)
Parameters:
incompleteTimeout - The required length of silence following user speech after which a recognizer finalizes an incomplete result. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/#dml6.3.2

setMaxSpeechTimeout

public void setMaxSpeechTimeout(TimeValue maxSpeechTimeout)
Parameters:
maxSpeechTimeout - The maximum duration of user speech. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/#dml6.3.2

setMaxNBest

public void setMaxNBest(Integer maxNBest)
Parameters:
maxNBest - The maximum size of the recognition result. Must be a positive integer. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/#dml6.3.2

setConfidenceLevel

public void setConfidenceLevel(Double confidenceLevel)
Parameters:
confidenceLevel - The speech recognition confidence level. Results with confidence below this value will be rejected (nomatch). Value must be between 0.0 and 1.0. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/#dml6.3.2

setSpeedVersusAccuracy

public void setSpeedVersusAccuracy(Double speedVersusAccuracy)
Parameters:
speedVersusAccuracy - A hint specifying the desired balance between speed versus accuracy. A value of 0.0 means fastest recognition. A value of 1.0 means best accuracy. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/#dml6.3.2

setSensitivity

public void setSensitivity(Double sensitivity)
Parameters:
sensitivity - Set the sensitivity level. A value of 1.0 means that it is highly sensitive to quiet input. A value of 0.0 means it is least sensitive to noise. Null reverts to VoiceXML default value.
